title: Mount Rinjani
summary: Mount Rinjani (Indonesian: Gunung Rinjani) is an active volcano in Indonesia on the island of Lombok. Administratively the mountain is in the Regency of North Lombok, West Nusa Tenggara (Indonesian: Nusa Tenggara Barat, NTB). It rises to 3,726 metres (12,224Â ft), making it the second highest volcano in Indonesia.[2] It is also the highest point in Indonesian province of West Nusa Tenggara
